alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued July 09 at 5:14PM MDT until July 09 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 513 PM MDT, areas of dense blowing dust were developing over the Lordsburg Playa. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar and surface observation reports. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 20. Locations impacted include... Steins, Road Forks and Lordsburg Playa. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this area of blowing dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
